column4: I have ubunutu installed on my HDD. Still it will not boot. If I use install CD I get the boot-menu, then I choose boot from first hard disk - this works!
can someone help me fix this and get booting from hard drive w/o CD ?
do you have more than one harddrives in your computer?
you'll want to make sure grub is installed right... give me one second
I would say try this if it isn't getting to grub. It should make sure that grub is the bootloader. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
thanks. I will try that. I will get back after a reboot.
I checked the link.. I tried the option for running grub within ubuntu: section "From Inside Ubuntu"
however, I don't see the item grub inside my /sbin directory
sorry... I didn't specify. just follow the quick start
ok. Was wondering you would say that... I have a file x-fer happenning that will take an hr or so. So I will try after that. Thanks for tip.
ok. if you need help i should still be here
I tried that link. It works fine now. Thanks a lot
my ubuntu can boot from hdd directly. WoW!
